page.title: 07School Health
page.content: Schools are regularly visited by a school health visitor. She looks at our fingers and in our{hair.}Head lice are quite uncommon but are occasionally found. More often, nits are found. These are the eggs of head lice and are cleared up by the use of a shampoo which is given free. Our {eyes}and our{teeth}are also looked at in school on a regular basis. Girls of ten years of age are able to have an injection against german measles. The school nurse also visits school to show a film and to talk about problems which girls experience at puberty. A while ago there was a scare about harmful effects from injections for whooping cough and measles. Some parents refise to have their children vacinated and so these diseases are increasing very slightly.
